There are two types of sign conventions in use when mesuing distances relative to thin lenses, in this case distances measured from the optical center of the lens towards your left hand side are considered negative and distances measured to your right hand side are considered positive.  Note that when it comes to a convergent lens, the focal lenght we consider is measured to the right and when it comes to a divergent lens, the focal lenght we consider is measured to the left.  There is a fancier way of putting it by dragging in primary and secondary focus of a lens as a supplimentary concept, but the above description is a simple way of putting it imo.
